intro: Epidendrum avicula, commonly known as the silver spike orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining potting media. Its leaves are typically elongated and covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Epidendrum avicula is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice for orchid enthusiasts.
